newsitem.title: ZIMBABWE: ZIMBABWE MONEY MARKET FLUSH, RATES LARGELY SOFTER.
newsitem.headline: ZIMBABWE MONEY MARKET FLUSH, RATES LARGELY SOFTER.

text.p: Zimbabwe's money market continued liquid on Wednesday with short-term trading rates quoted largely easier, dealers said.

They said the Reserve Bank had not auctioned any treasury bills as a liquidity control measure on Wednesday but discount houses were selling the central bank paper in the secondary market at 16.25 percent, down from 16.30 percent.

NCDs redeemable after after 30, 60 and 90 days were quoted steady at 17.25 and 17 percent (buying and selling respectively) but bankers acceptance rates softened to 16.60 percent (buying) from 17 percent and were selling at 16.35 percent, down from 16.75 percent.
Call money, which previously fluctuated between 16.50 and 16.75 percent was indicated at around 16 percent.
The market closed in surplus of Z$103 million on Tuesday from Z$159.5 million.
